flawed_nl_solution:
The discount for the Delta flight would come to $850 * 0.2 = $<<850*0.2=170>>170.
The final price of the Delta flight would come to $850 - $170 = $<<850-170=680>>680.
The discount of the United flight would come to $1100 * 0.3 = $<<1100*0.3=330>>330.
The final price of the United flight would come to $1100 - $330 = $<<1100-330=771>>771.
The Delta flight would be cheaper than the United flight by $771 - $680 = $<<771-680=91>>91.
#### 91

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 770, not 771. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
